summary: This is an FBI 302 report documenting an attempted interview at a residence on July 23, 2019. The subject, whose name is redacted, immediately invoked her right to counsel upon being asked about Jeffrey Epstein, and was served with a federal grand jury subpoena. The report notes the presence of another individual who witnessed the service.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The reason the FBI agents were at the residence; the subject stated his name when asked why she thought agents were there.

events.title: FBI Attempted Interview and Subpoena Service
events.description: FBI agents attempted to interview a subject at her residence. The subject invoked her right to counsel upon hearing Jeffrey Epstein's name and was served with a federal grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Epstein Arrest in Miami
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested in Miami, Florida.

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, FBI agents attempted to interview a subject at her residence in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
The subject immediately invoked her right to counsel upon hearing Jeffrey Epstein's name, indicating a potential link or knowledge she wished to protect legally.
The subject was served with a federal grand jury subpoena, compelling her testimony or evidence.
Another individual, whose name is redacted, was present and witnessed the service of the subpoena.
The document references Epstein's arrest in Miami, Florida on July 6, 2019, placing this interview in the immediate aftermath of that event.
